original: @34a # // rgya gar skad du /
analyzed: @34a # // rgya gar skad du /
translated: In Sanskrit:

original: autstshu sma dzam bha la s'a dha nam /
analyzed: autstshu sma dzam bha la s'a dha nam /
translated: Utsusmajambhalasādhana

original: bod skad du /
analyzed: bod skad du /
translated: In Tibetan:

original: autstshusma dzam bha la'i sgrub pa'i thabs /
analyzed: autstshusma dzam bha la'i sgrub pa'i thabs /
translated: Utsusmajambhala's Means of Achievement

original: bcom ldan 'das dzam bha la la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das dzam bha la la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: Homage to the Blessed Jambhala.

original: aom a'a:zhes bya bas phab ste /
analyzed: aom a'a:zhes bya bas phab ste /
translated: With Om Aḥ, one should cause descent.

original: rang gi snying gar aa yongs su gyur pa las zla ba'i dkyil 'khor gyi dbus su h'um las rdo rje rtse dgu pa'i dbus su dbang po sbas pa lta bu'i h'um yig go //
analyzed: rang gi snying gar aa yongs su gyur pa las zla ba'i dkyil 'khor gyi dbus su h'um las rdo rje rtse dgu pa'i dbus su dbang po sbas pa lta bu'i h'um yig go //
translated: In the center of a moon maṇḍala that has arisen from the transformation of the letter A in one's heart, there is a nine-tined vajra arisen from Hūṃ. In the center of that, there is a letter Hūṃ like Indra's hidden treasure.

original: sngon du bstan pa 'bebs pa'i sngags kyis phab la /
analyzed: sngon du bstan pa 'bebs pa'i sngags kyis phab la /
translated: Having caused descent with the previously taught descent mantra,

original: dzam bha la mgon po rang gi snying gar rab tu bcug pas /
analyzed: dzam bha la mgon po rang gi snying gar rab tu bcug pas /
translated: one should place Lord Jambhala in one's heart.

original: autstshusma mi'u thung gi gzugs rna ba ma phug pa mdog nag pa /
analyzed: autstshusma mi'u thung gi gzugs rna ba ma phug pa mdog nag pa /
translated: Utsusma, having the form of a dwarf, with unpierced ears, black in color,

original: skra kham pa gyen du bsgreng ba /
analyzed: skra kham pa gyen du bsgreng ba /
translated: with tawny hair standing upward,

original: lus thung bar byed cing khro gnyer can /
analyzed: lus thung bar byed cing khro gnyer can /
translated: with a short body, wrathful,

original: mche ba dang ldan pa rin chen 'byung ldan gyi dbu rgyan can /
analyzed: mche ba dang ldan pa rin chen 'byung ldan gyi dbu rgyan can /
translated: with fangs, and with a crown of Ratnasambhava.

original: klu chen po brgyad kyi rgyan gyis brgyan pa'i g-yon pa'i phyag na rin po che la sogs pa skyugs pa'i sre mo bsnams pa /
analyzed: klu chen po brgyad kyi rgyan gyis brgyan pa'i g-yon pa'i phyag na rin po che la sogs pa skyugs pa'i sre mo bsnams pa /
translated: He is adorned with the ornaments of the eight great nāgas, and in his left hand he holds a mongoose vomiting jewels and so forth.

original: g-yas na khrag gis bkang ba'i thod pa bsnams pa'o //
analyzed: g-yas na khrag gis bkang ba'i thod pa bsnams pa'o //
translated: In his right hand he holds a skull cup filled with blood.

original: mgo g-yas phyogs su bstan pa'i gser gyi mdog can /
analyzed: mgo g-yas phyogs su bstan pa'i gser gyi mdog can /
translated: The head is facing to the right and is golden in color.

original: rgyan sna tshogs kyis brgyan pa'i nor sbyin 'gyel ba la zhabs gnyis kyis mnan pas rin po che'i snyem la sogs pa skyugs par byed pa'o //
analyzed: rgyan sna tshogs kyis brgyan pa'i nor sbyin 'gyel ba la zhabs gnyis kyis mnan pas rin po che'i snyem la sogs pa skyugs par byed pa'o //
translated: He is stepping on the fallen Kubera, who is adorned with various ornaments and is vomiting jewels and so forth.

original: 'od 'phro ba'i phreng ba 'khrigs pa'i bdag nyid du bsams la /
analyzed: 'od 'phro ba'i phreng ba 'khrigs pa'i bdag nyid du bsams la /
translated: Imagine that he is the nature of a mass of blazing light.

original: autstshusma'i g-yas pa'i phyag tu aam las skyes pa gru gsum pa sa ka ta bsam mo //
analyzed: autstshusma'i g-yas pa'i phyag tu aam las skyes pa gru gsum pa sa ka ta bsam mo //
translated: In Uṣṇīṣa’s right hand, think that from aṃ arises a triangular fire pit.

original: bam las skyes pa'i bum @34b ba bzang po 'bo bzhin pa'o //
analyzed: bam las skyes pa'i bum @34b ba bzang po 'bo bzhin pa'o //
translated: Think that from vaṃ arises an excellent vase, which is overflowing.

original: lag pa'i dbus su dzam ngo //
analyzed: lag pa'i dbus su dzam ngo //
translated: In the center of the hand is jaṃ.

original: sdigs mdzub la bha'o //🔽gung mo la la'o //🔽srin lag la dza'o //
analyzed: sdigs mdzub la bha'o // gung mo la la'o // srin lag la dza'o //
translated: On the index finger is bhrūṃ.🔽On the middle finger is laṃ.

original: mthe'u chud la len no //
analyzed: mthe'u chud la len no //
translated: On the ring finger is jaṃ.🔽On the pinky finger is vaṃ.

original: mtheb chen la dra'o //
analyzed: mtheb chen la dra'o //
translated: On the thumb is raṃ.

original: mkhrig mgul du ya'o //
analyzed: mkhrig mgul du ya'o //
translated: On the wrist.

original: de nas sv'a h'a zhes pa ni logs gnyis la'o //
analyzed: de nas sv'a h'a zhes pa ni logs gnyis la'o //
translated: Then svāhā on the two sides.

original: sngags dgod pa bsgom pa'i rim pa'o /
analyzed: sngags dgod pa bsgom pa'i rim pa'o /
translated: This is the sequence of the visualization of the mantra placement.

original: kha mngon par bsngags la chu sbyin sbyin par bya'o //
analyzed: kha mngon par bsngags la chu sbyin sbyin par bya'o //
translated: Having consecrated the mouth, one should give water.

original: aom dzl'um sv'a h'a /
analyzed: aom dzl'um sv'a h'a /
translated: Oṃ jalamu svāhā.

original: chu khyor ba nas sbyin pa'i sngags so //
analyzed: chu khyor ba nas sbyin pa'i sngags so //
translated: This is the mantra for giving water from the cupped hands.

original: aom aindra ni mu kham bhra ma ri sv'a h'a /🔽lag pa nas kha /
analyzed: aom aindra ni mu kham bhra ma ri sv'a h'a / lag pa nas kha /
translated: Oṃ indranimukha bhramarī svāhā.🔽From the hand to the mouth.

original: kha nas lag pa /
analyzed: kha nas lag pa /
translated: From the mouth to the hand.

original: de nas zhal du sbyin par bya'o //
analyzed: de nas zhal du sbyin par bya'o //
translated: Then one should give it to the mouth.

original: de ltar snying rjes sems can dbul ba'i sdug bsngal bcad pa'i don du dzam bha la bsgom pa ni dzam bha la nyid du 'gyur ro //🔽autstshusma dzam bha la'i sgrub pa'i thabs rnal 'byor pa dga' ba sbyin gyis mdzad pa rdzogs so //
analyzed: de ltar snying rjes sems can dbul ba'i sdug bsngal bcad pa'i don du dzam bha la bsgom pa ni dzam bha la nyid du 'gyur ro // autstshusma dzam bha la'i sgrub pa'i thabs rnal 'byor pa dga' ba sbyin gyis mdzad pa rdzogs so //
translated: Thus, the meditation on Jambhala for the purpose of cutting the suffering of poverty of sentient beings with compassion becomes Jambhala himself.🔽The sādhana of Ucchuṣma Jambhala composed by Yogī Nandadāsa is complete.

original: pandi ta don yod rdo rje dang / khams pa lo ts'a ba dge slong ba ris bsgyur cing zhus pa'o//
analyzed: pandi ta don yod rdo rje dang / khams pa lo ts'a ba dge slong ba ris bsgyur cing zhus pa'o//
translated: It was translated, revised, and finalized by the paṇḍita Amoghavajra and the Khampa translator-editor Gelong Bar.
